page.title: 13LOCAL THEATRE AND LAINDON
page.content: The{Towngate Theatre}in Basildon provides a variety of entertainment for people who live in Laindon. There are concerts, plays, pantomimes, opera and rock shows performed there. The main theatre can hold four hundred people and the small studio holds up to seventy five people. The{Towngate}provides special facilities for the handicapped. For people in wheelchairs there are ramps so that they can manoeuvre their way easily into the theatre. There are also ten chairs reserved for handicapped people. None of the London theatres provide such a good service. For people who are hard of hearing, there is a special hearing device. The Towngate will be knocked down in 1989 and{Basildon Council}will build a new theatre. The new theatre will hold 750 people.
